'Hello, everyone! WE ARE L☆SEVEN!'%K%P
The gods are nourished by Sakimitama,\nwhich brings forth their Jinriki.%K%P
Sakimitama means the good hearts and good will of\nhumanity. Faithful minds create better Sakimitama,\nwhich become a source of strength for the gods.%K%P
And the path chosen by many goddesses to\ngather Sakimitama in today's society was,\noddly enough, the entertainment industry.%K%P
'We're so grateful you all came to see us today! \nNow come on everybody, let's have some fun!'%K%P
This was the Divine Idol group L☆SEVEN. \nThey were the most popular idol group of all.%K%P
Playing on the big screen in front of Akihabara\nstation was L☆SEVEN's concert footage.%K%P
Seeing as how they were all goddesses, of course they\nwere beautiful, and they were great singers and\ndancers. No wonder they could get so popular.%K%P
'But whenever she comes by the house,\nshe's such a normal, down-to-earth girl.'%K%P
Sara Benzaiten, the center girl in L☆SEVEN,\nwas someone I knew personally.%K%P
But the girl who glittered up there on stage\nwas like a completely different person.%K%P
I was proud of all her hard work, but at the same\ntime there was a distance between us;\nit was a complicated feeling.%K%P
'But anyway, there sure are a lot of goddesses\naround Akiba these days.'%K%P
Driven by L☆SEVEN's popularity,\nDivine Idols were increasing by the day.%K%P
Countless goddesses gathered here in Akihabara,\nthe holy land for pop idols.%K%P
They put on gaudy costumes, passed out\nflyers, and of course performed.%K%P
A year ago this place was packed with\nmere humans, now it was full of goddesses\nwith aspirations of idolhood.%K%P
But no one really bats an eyelash at all\nthe goddesses now.%K%P
A year after the Descent,\nthey're already a normal part of daily life.%K%P
Or at least, that's what I thought.%K%P
The intro flowing out of the speakers was solemn,\nlike old imperial court music.%K%P
But just when I thought it was another old Divine\nIdol, it flipped into a catchy pop melody.%K%P
'Ooohhh♪'%K%P
Powerful vocals exploded out of the speakers.%K%P
All the passersby stopped what they were doing\nin response to the singing.%K%P
But that was over in an instant. Most of the people\nquickly returned to their daily lives, walking off\nsomewhere.%K%P
Those who stayed, however, were enthralled by her\nsong. I was one of those.%K%P
'This... Really is something.'%K%P
This little corner was overrun with a kind of heat\nthat cut right to a person's soul.%K%P
She wasn't dressed like an idol, she was wearing\nthe uniform of a nearby school, and her equipment\nwas cheap busker-level stuff. %K%P
Even then, when she sang,\nfor an instant she sparkled, too.%K%P
Her passionate performance touched something\nin me, and soon I was moving my body without\neven realizing it.%K%P
'Shuuurii!!'%K%P
'Thank you so much, everyone!' \nOkay then, it's about that time!'%K%P
At her call, some unseen force began to respond.%K%P
Around her uniformed figure,\ncountless balls of light appeared.%K%P
They spun along with her dance moves, glittering,\nand turned the performance into a gorgeous show.%K%P
No human could have done it, it was divine work.%K%P
She turned up the voltage,\nand the street corner went wild.%K%P
Her voice grew more fiery,\nand her dancing more fervent.%K%P
The crowd cheered as one,\ntheir fists raised in the air.%K%P
'Shuuurii!!'%K%P
It was like something out of a movie. And to think,\nI hadn't felt it anything special before!%K%P
'So this is what a Divine Idol is really like...'%K%P
I'd been completely enthralled,\nby the power of a live Divine Idol show.%K%P
Now I understood. \nI knew why everyone was so crazy about L☆SEVEN.%K%P
The whirling lights started to close in,\nand the song sounded like it was coming to a close.%K%P
But the dancing lights didn't hold my eyes. \nThey were fixed on her, still singing so happily.%K%P
'Okay then, I hope to see you all at my next show!'%K%P
I ended up staying to the very end.%K%P
I was warmed through and through. \nThe performance still resonated through me, undying.%K%P
'I think she said her name was Shuri Kisshouten...'%K%P
Apparently she was striving to become\na Divine Idol, too.%K%P
She was still an amateur compared to L☆SEVEN. \nBut I couldn't deny I had been moved by her\nperformance.%K%P
There was something special about her voice,\nsomething that reached into people's hearts.%K%P
Was it something every Divine Idol had,\nor something particular to her?%K%P
As it was, I didn't really know,\nbut I wanted to find out more.%K%P
This place, Akihabara,\nhad long been a holy land for pop idols.%K%P
Girls with dreams of idolhood had come,\nand then gone.%K%P
There were those whose dreams came true,\nand they mounted the big stage,\nand those whose dreams had died here.%K%P
Akihabara was a place with milestones for either\npath, a place of varicolored memories.%K%P
That will surely never change, not for people,\nand not for goddesses.%K%P
Divine Idols are hatched here,\nand someday they may spread their wings and fly away.%K%P
Fly away to that big sparkling stage...%K%P
